questions.question: Confirm the equipment with below provided image of the equipment.
upload the image of the equipment, contact the technical team for recorrections and scan the bar code again.
confirm is there any physical damage of the equipment.
prepare the Incident / Damage and Missing Report.
connect the equipment to the mains and confirm whether the equipment is getting ON and the LED’s illuminate.
check and confirm whether the wall outlet is provided with AC Voltage 230.

videos.src: assets/videos/BPL 9852/VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING THE WALL OUTLET VOLTAGE.mp4
videos.videoName: VIDEO REQUIRED FOR CHECKING THE WALL OUTLET VOLTAGE

questions.question: shift the equipment to another place where the AC voltage of 230 is provided
check the power cord adapter and confirm whether DC voltage of 14 is available.
replace the power adaptor with a new one
repair / replace the Control board with a new one

videos.videoName: Video for replacing the control board

questions.question: check and confirm whether the Doppler probe error appears on the display.
connect the probe again and confirm whether the problem still persist.
cross check the probe with another and confirm whether the probe is defective.
replace the probe with a new one
check and confirm whether there is any damage of probe pin connector.
replace the probe pin connector
repair / replace the control board accordingly
check and confirm whether the buttons do not respond while pressing.
open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm is there any loose connection or breakage of cable from switch control board to control board.
reseat or replace the cables accordingly
check the continuity of buttons and confirm whether the buttons are defective.
replace the switch accordingly
repair / replace the switch control board accordingly
check and confirm whether the print is dull or partial in the print out.
open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm is there any loose connection or breakage of cable from thermal head to control board.
reseat or replace the cable accordingly
clean the thermal head with a soft tissue and confirm whether the problem still persist.
replace the thermal head with a new one
check and confirm whether paper roll does not move during print out.
place the paper roll properly and confirm whether the problem still persist.
open the equipment as shown in the video, check and confirm is there any dust or obstruction in the gears.
clean the dust or obstruction
check and confirm is there any damage to the gears.
replace the gears with a new one
replace the motor with a new one
If the problem is not yet solved, contact the Technical Team for any other assistance through video call
Thanks
